snippet: A decision by the German Constitutional Court and results from a Dutch election may mean that the worst is over for the euro, or so European Union leaders hope.
abstract: News analysis; European Union is given a boost as the German Constitutional Court declares the European Stability Mechanism legal, clearing the way to recapitalize troubled banks and governments; with anti-euro parties losing seats in the Dutch Parliament, combined with the European Central Bank's plan to restart its bond-buying program, European leaders may begin to feel that the worst is over, at least for now.
lead_paragraph: A decision by the German Constitutional Court and results from a Dutch election may mean that the worst is over for the euro, or so European Union leaders hope.

headline.seo: European Union Celebrates German and Dutch Decisions
headline.main: Dutch and Germans Give European Union Reasons to Cheer
headline.print_headline: Dutch and Germans Give European Union Reasons to Cheer
